0: [     {        "SPACE": {           "Cells": {              "value_boundaries": [                 {"min": "0", "max": "100"},                 {"min": "-20", "max": "-40"}              ],              "equation": "y = x^2 - 20*x + 40",              "order_number": 2,              "frequency": 100           }        },        "Cells": {           "value_boundaries": [              {"min": "0", "max": "100"},              {"min": "-20", "max": "-40"}           ]        }     }]Q:How can I get the index of the first occurrence of a character in a string?I have a string like this:var str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";And I want to find out which position it starts at. So far I've tried something like this:str.indexOf("c"); // returns -1But how do I get the index of the first occurrence of c starting at 0?A:You could use String#search() method. It will return the index of the first occurence of substring if found, otherwise -1.const str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";console.log(str.search('c')); // 0console.log(str.search('d')); // -1console.log(str.search('f')); // -1console.log(str.search('b')); // -1console.log(str.search('c')); // 0A:If you're looking for the index of the first occurrence of a character in a string, you can use.findIndex():let str = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz".split("")// ["a","b","c","d","e","f","g","h","i","j","k","l","m","n","o","p","q","r","s","t","u","v","w","x","y","z"]let
